verses.text: 神與亞伯蘭立約這些事以後，耶和華的話在異象中臨到亞伯蘭說：「亞伯蘭，你不要懼怕，我是你的盾牌；你的賞賜是很大的。」

words.note: A verb-object compound common in biblical texts.
Refers to a divine revelation or supernatural sight.
Often used for spiritual or divine arrival.
Common phrase in 'do not fear' exhortations in the Bible.
Figurative language for protection.
Refers to a divine blessing or reward.

verses.text: 亞伯蘭說：「主耶和華啊，我一向都沒有孩子，你還能賜給我甚麼呢？這樣，承受我家業的，就是大馬士革人以利以謝了。」

words.note: Often used for gifts from a superior or deity.
Refers to the entire estate or lineage of a family.

verses.text: 亞伯蘭又說：「你既然沒有給我後裔，那生在我家中的人，就是我的繼承人了。」

words.note: Crucial term in biblical covenants and promises.
Refers to one who inherits property or title.

verses.text: 耶和華的話又臨到亞伯蘭說：「這人必不會作你的繼承人；你親生的才會是你的繼承人。」

words.note: Often used for spiritual or divine arrival.
Refers to one who inherits property or title.
Emphasizes direct lineage, often contrasted with adopted or household members.
Refers to one who inherits property or title.

verses.text: 於是領他到外面去，說：「你向天觀看，數點眾星，看你能不能把它們數得清楚。」又對他說：「你的後裔將要這樣眾多。」

words.note: Common imagery in biblical promises of numerous descendants.
Rhetorical question structure, 'Can you or can you not?'
Indicates the result of counting can be achieved.
Crucial term in biblical covenants and promises.

verses.text: 亞伯蘭信耶和華，耶和華就以此算為他的義了。

words.note: Contextually refers to faith in God.

words.definition: by this, on account of this

words.note: In biblical context, refers to righteousness or justice.

verses.text: 耶和華又對亞伯蘭說：「我是耶和華，曾經把你從迦勒底的吾珥領出來，為要把這地賜給你作產業。」

words.note: Introduces object of a verb, indicating action on it.
A verb-complement construction indicating leading someone out and towards the speaker.
Introduces object of a verb, indicating action on it.
A formal or polite way to say 'give'.
In biblical context, often refers to an inherited possession or heritage.

verses.text: 亞伯蘭說：「主耶和華啊，我憑甚麼能知道我必得這地為業呢？」

words.note: Used as a title for God.
To take or hold something as one's possession or inheritance.

verses.text: 耶和華對他說：「你給我拿一頭三歲的母牛犢，一隻三歲的母山羊，一隻三歲的公綿羊，一隻斑鳩和一隻雛鴿。」

words.note: Here means 'for me' or 'on my behalf'.
An animal specified for sacrifice in the Old Testament.
An animal specified for sacrifice in the Old Testament.
An animal specified for sacrifice in the Old Testament.
A bird specified for sacrifice in the Old Testament.
A young bird specified for sacrifice in the Old Testament.

verses.text: 亞伯蘭就把這一切拿了來，每樣都從當中劈開，一半一半相對擺列；只是鳥卻沒有劈開。

words.note: Introduces object of a verb, indicating action on it.
了 is a perfective aspect particle. 拿來 means 'bring (something) here'.

verses.text: 有鷙鳥下來，落在這些屍骸上，亞伯蘭就把牠們嚇走了。

words.note: Specifically refers to predatory birds.
Often used in a formal or literary context, like scripture.
Compound verb indicating the result of scaring is them leaving.

verses.text: 日落的時候，亞伯蘭沉沉地睡著了，忽然有可怕的大黑暗落在他身上。

words.note: Repetition of '沉' emphasizes the depth/heaviness of sleep.
著 indicates the successful completion of falling asleep.

verses.text: 耶和華對亞伯蘭說：「你要確實地知道，你的後裔必在外地寄居，也必服事那地的人，那地的人苦待他們四百年。

words.note: Commonly used in the Bible for lineage and posterity.
Often used in scripture to describe living in a foreign land as a temporary resident.
Can imply both service and servitude.
Indicates suffering and harsh treatment.

verses.text: 他們所要服事的那國，我要親自懲罰。後來他們必帶著很多財物，從那裡出來。

words.note: Forms a nominal phrase: 'that which they will serve'.
Refers to valuable goods or property.

verses.text: 你必得享長壽，被人埋葬，平平安安地回到你列祖那裡。

words.note: Often used in blessings and traditional contexts.
Reduplication emphasizes the state of peace and safety.
Refers to a line of ancestors.
Implies returning to join his ancestors in death.

verses.text: 到了第四代，他們必回到這裡，因為亞摩利人的罪孽還沒有滿盈。」

words.note: Refers to moral evil or offense against God.
Often used in religious contexts for fullness of time/sin.

verses.text: 日落天黑的時候，忽然有冒煙的爐和燒著的火把，從那些肉塊中經過。
就在那時候，耶和華與亞伯蘭立約說：「我已經把這地賜給你的後裔了，就是從埃及河直到幼發拉底河之地；

words.note: Implies a gift from a superior to an inferior.
Often refers to the Wadi of Egypt, not necessarily the Nile.
Literary/archaic particle similar to '的'.

verses.text: 就是基尼人、基尼洗人、甲摩尼人、
赫人、比利洗人、利乏音人、
亞摩利人、迦南人、革迦撒人、耶布斯人之地。」

words.note: Literary possessive or modifying particle, similar to 'de'.
